Class PigLatinWords

java.lang.Object
  PigLatinWords
public class PigLatinWords
extends java.lang.Object

The PigLatinWords class translates words to PigLatin using the rules:

  1. Words that start with a vowel (A,E,I,O,U) simply have "WAY" appended to the end
  2. Words that start with a consonant have all consonant letters up to the first vowel moved to the end of the word and AY appended
  3. Words that have only Y as a vowel (by, my, try) simply have AY appended to the end
All words that can be translated must be at least one letter long and may only contain letters.

Version:

Jason Schwarz (Jason_Schwarz@ncsu.edu)

Method Detail

setWord

public void setWord(java.lang.String newWord)
Set the word to be translated to pig latin. This method accepts non-null values.

Parameters:
newWord - the word to translate into pig latin

getWord

public java.lang.String getWord()
Retrieve the word to be translated in the original form.

Returns:
the original word as entered by setWord

getPigWord

public java.lang.String getPigWord()
Retrieve the pig latin version of the word.

Returns:
the translated word in pig latin

getTotalCount

public int getTotalCount()
Retrieves the total number of words which have been set by setWords. Each time a non-null setWord is called the count increments by one.

Returns:
the total number of words entered to setWord

getPigCount

public int getPigCount()
Retrieves the total number of words which could be translated to pig latin.

Returns:
the total number of words which were translated

getNonPigCount

public int getNonPigCount()
Retrieves the total number of words which could not be translated to pig latin.

Returns:
the total number of words which were not translated
